headings: Mental Health and Wellness Counseling – Online LPC Bridge
paragraphs: Prepare for licensure as a licensed professional counselor (LPC) in Texas.

Mental Health and Wellness Counseling – Online LPC Bridge coursework prepares students to apply for licensureonlyin the state of Texas. Students must assume responsibilities for securing a practicum site(s) and a Licensed Professional Counselor Supervisor (LPC-S), and maintaining constant communication with the supervisor to meet the LPC-A state licensure pre-requisite requirements.
After completing the LPC supplement courses outlined in theTexas Administrative Code, students seeking licensure as a professional counselor in Texas must:

Requirements for licensure vary from state to state. Our online bridge prepares students for licensureONLYin the state of Texas. We do not imply that our online bridge prepares students for licensure in other states.
You may also find out more information about the counseling profession through the following professional counseling websites:
This graduate-level online bridge consists of 30 credit hours*. That means you only have to complete 10 courses to be ready to apply for licensure.
The combination of our M.A. in Mental Health and Wellness Counseling program and the Online LPC Bridge meet the academic requirements to apply for LPC licensure.
If you want to go fast, go alone. But if you want to go far, go together.

Classes are delivered totally online in eight-week terms. Asynchronous courses allow for schedule flexibility.
Relevant learning and field experience opportunities are embedded in course activities and the required program practicums.
Develop expertise in biological, social and cultural factors that impact mental health and wellness in varied populations.
Gain a strong foundation to deliver ethical and culturally competent counseling services to support individuals, communities and organizations.
Submit official transcripts from the institutions where you earned your bachelor’s and master’s degrees.
Master’s degree in counseling or counseling-related field
Pass the National Counselor Exam (NCE) or the National Clinical Mental Health Counselor Exam (NCMHC) (NBCC Exams).
Pass the Texas State Board of Examiners of Professional Counseling Texas Jurisprudence Exam (BHEC LPC Jurisprudence Exam).

Secure a master’s-level/doctoral-level,board-approved Licensed Professional Counselor-Supervisor (LPC-S)through the Texas State Board of Examiners of Professional Counselors. This information will be submitted on the Supervisory Agreement Form for LPC Associate license application.

Apply for an LPC Associate license through the Texas Behavioral Health Executive Council. This involves an application process through anOnline Licensing Systemto submit requirements, including thePracticum Documentation Formand theSupervisory Agreement Form. Additional documentation from third parties is also required for application and outlined onBHEC Applying for a License.

Once granted licensure as an LPC Associate, you will accrue the required 3,000 clock hours (1,500 direct counseling) under your board-approved supervisor for application for licensure as a Licensed Professional Counselor.
